Title: A Fistful of Dollars
Taglines: In his own way he is perhaps, the most dangerous man who ever lived!
Production_Co: Jolly Film, Constantin Film Produktion, Ocean Films
Show detailed company contact information on IMDbPro »
Trivia: During its 1969 American re-release, it was double-billed with For a Few Dollars More (1965). See more »
Goofs: Joe walks into a room with five bad guys, and starts shooting. Only four gunshots are heard, but when the smoke clears all five baddies are down. See more »
Cast: Clint Eastwood, Marianne Koch, Gian Maria Volontè, Wolfgang Lukschy, Sieghardt Rupp, Joseph Egger, Antonio Prieto, José Calvo, Margarita Lozano, Daniel Martín, Benito Stefanelli, Mario Brega, Bruno Carotenuto, Aldo Sambrell
Plot: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge. An anonymous, but deadly man rides into a town torn by war between two factions, the Baxters and the Rojo's. Instead of fleeing or dying, as most other would do, the man schemes to play the two sides off each other, getting rich in the bargain. Written by Andrew Hyatt <dres@uiuc.edu>
Keywords: bar, revenge, drifter, mexican, grindhouse film
Actors: Clint Eastwood, Gian Maria Volontè, Marianne Koch
Writer: Adriano Bolzoni (story) (as A. Bonzzoni), Víctor Andrés Catena (story) | 4 more credits »
Description: Directed by Sergio Leone.  With Clint Eastwood, Gian Maria Volontè, Marianne Koch, Wolfgang Lukschy. A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.
